intro: Libanotis montana-ferulacea, commonly known as the mountain ferulacean, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, clustered umbels of white or pale yellow flowers. The plant has finely divided, aromatic leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of hairs. Native to mountainous regions of Europe, it thrives in well-drained soils and cooler climates. It is often found in alpine meadows and rocky slopes, where it contributes to the biodiversity of its habitat.
